content.description: West facing dihedral with hand crack. Climb thirty feet up to ledge and finish off on face to your left.
content.protection: Pro up to #2 will suffice. Can make a strong anchor on top with protection.
content.location: From parking spot/campground head east down shallow gully to the river. A trail will lead you down. On top of shallow cliffs over the river size up this area, and in the middle you will find Temptation. It is easiest to find Temptation by finding its partner, Aztec Camera (face with an obvious crack up the middle), 10 feet left of Temptation.

content.description: A nice dihedral with hand to finger jams. The climb is ascetically beautiful with hardly any use, so cleaning out a hold here and there may be necessary. If you want to split the climb in two pitches there are two comfortable ledges to belay from.
content.protection: Anchors with chains at top allow you to drop in. Top rope out or pull the rope for your lead. Standard rack with nothing larger than a #3.
content.location: From your parking/camping spot travel 400 meters west until you reach a gully. The climb is on the east side of the gully.

content.description: Thin foot and handholds requiring careful sequencing. Crack is not as helpful as it seems it should be.
content.protection: Small to no protection at the beginning. Small for the upper half. Same anchor set up as for Temptation can be used. Prefer this route as a top rope until dialed.
content.location: From the parking spot/camping area head east down shallow gully to the river. A trail will lead you down. Size up this shallow cliff area and about right in the middle is Aztec Camera. To be sure to the west 10 feet should be a west facing dihedral, Temptation.
